metadata.description:
'nobody loves you' explores the themes of isolation and loneliness, as well as a personal struggle with mental illness. This record was written after a string of tragic deaths of peers in the music industry, as well as the loss of a family member. 'nobody loves you' delves into the idea that we often wait until it's too late to really show our love, appreciation and respect for each other. 

It was written by Sara Phillips, and produced with Mike Daley and Mitchell Owens. 

10% of all primary sales of this record will be donated to the The Trevor Project - focused on suicide prevention and providing 24/7 crisis support services to LGBTQ young people. Thank you so much for helping this incredibly important cause.

lyrics.text:
I've been counting my money and my friends 
Don't know where everything went
I've been drowning in quiet cold regret 
And I'm still soaking wet

And the hills have eyes
And they tell me things I don't like, 
don't like
(and they say)

Nobody loves you
Nobody nobody nobody loves you till you're gone
Nobody loves you
Nobody nobody nobody loves you till you're gone
Nobody loves you
Nobody nobody nobody loves you till you're gone
Nobody loves you
But everybody loves you when you go

I've been silently dying underneath a picture perfect sea 
I've been lying wide-eyed when I should sleep 
In bed with monsters under me

And the hills have eyes
And they tell me things I don't like, 
don't like
(and they say)

Nobody loves you
Nobody nobody nobody loves you till you're gone
Nobody loves you
Nobody nobody nobody loves you till you're gone
Nobody loves you
Nobody nobody nobody loves you till you're gone
Nobody loves you
But everybody loves you when you go

I've been counting my money and my friends 
Don't know where everything went

metadata.name: nobody loves you #1
